name: Teop

sentences: A moon paa tara bona visoasi
The woman saw the boy
A otei paa ani bona taba’ani
The man ate the food
A visoasi paa tara bona kae
The boy saw the bag
A oraoraa paa ani bona overe
The sorcerer ate the coconut
A otei paa dao bona beiko
The man called the child
A beiko paa tasu bona iana
The child struck the fish
A oraoraa paa asun bona iana
The sorcerer killed the fish
A moon paa tasu bona vasu.
The woman struck the stone
A beiko paa asun bona visoasi
The child killed the boy
A moon paa ani bona iana
The woman ate the fish
enaa paa tara vuan
I saw you (sg)
Ean paa tara anna
You (sg) saw me
Eam paa dao e
You (pl) called him
Eori paa hee ameam a overe
They gave the coconut to you (pl)
Eove paa hee anna a overe
He gave the coconut to me
Enam paa dao vuan
We called you (sg)
Enaa paa dao ameam
I called you (pl)
Ean paa hee anna a overe
You (sg) gave the coconut to me
A otei paa dao bona beiko bona iana

Enaa paa dao a beiko bona iana
I called the boy a fish
Enaa paa hee vuan a iana
I gave you (sg) a fish
Enaa paa hee e bona iana
I gave him a fish
Enaa paa tasu vuan a bona.
I struck you (sg) with it
Enaa paa dao a overe bona vasu.
I called the coconut a stone
A otei paa hee anna bona overe
The man gave me a coconut
Ean paa tasu anaa.
You (sg) struck me
Eove paa ani bona iana.
He ate the fish
Enam paa tasu a beiko.

A otei paa tara bona kae.
The man saw the bag
Enaa paa tara a taba’ani.
I saw the food
A visoasi paa asun bona.
The boy killed him
Eam paa baitono e.
You (pl) heard him
Enaa paa hee a otei bona overe.
I gave the coconut to the man
A moon paa hee ameam bona taba’ani.
The woman gave the food to you (pl)
Enaa paa tasu vuan a vasu.
I struck you (sg) with the stone
Eori paa asun bona moon bona toraara.
They killed the woman with the axe
Enam paa dao a visoasi bona oraoraa.
We called the boy a sorcerer
Eam paa ani a overe.
You (pl) ate the coconut.
Ean paa tasu a oraoraa bona kae.
You (sg) struck the sorcerer with the bag.
Eove paa tara ameam.
He saw you (pl)
Enam paa hee vuan a taba’ani.
We gave the food to you (sg).
Eove paa dao anaa bona beiko.
He called me a child.
Enaa paa asun e bona.
I killed him with it
A oraoraa paa hee bona visoasi bona iana.
The sorcerer gave the fish to the boy.

note: The language belongs to the Austronesian family. It is spoken by approx. 5 000 people in Papua New Guinea.
